images.summary: This elevation view shows the front and side of the Hideaway 160 model with a full loft. The structure uses 2x6 tongue and groove stacked walls, as indicated by the text '2x6 TONGUE & GROOVE STACKED WALL (TYP.)'. The drawing specifies that the foundation is to be provided by others, noted as 'FOUNDATION BY OTHERS (TYP.)'. Key dimensions include a roof angle of 23°, a width of 96.000 inches, and a height of 134.910 inches. The drawing emphasizes maintaining a minimum of two unnotched rows of wall above openings, which act as supporting lintels. The text 'PARTIAL BOARD (2) FULL BOARDS ABOVE THE WINDOWS' suggests modifications for window placement.

images.location: Rear and Side Elevation of Rockwood with Full Loft
images.orientation: Side elevation showing roof and wall structure
images.summary: This elevation view shows the rear and side of the Rockwood model with a full loft. The drawing includes detailed dimensions for the roof and wall structures, with a note indicating that all dimensions are in inches. The roof structure is supported by elements labeled KG0 through KG8, and the walls are constructed using 2x6 tongue and groove stacked walls. The foundation is to be provided by others, as noted. Key dimensions include a roof span of 120.000 inches and wall heights of 136.715 and 139.405 inches. The fascia boards are noted to be all around the structure.
